revised_title: Effect of Polar Groups on Equilibrium Pressure and Surface Tension of Fats
tldr: The authors studied the behavior of fats and lenses on the surface of water, focusing on the effect of the polar group on equilibrium pressure. They found that the slopes of the crystals' behavior are determined by the hydrocarbon chain, while the polar group influences the slope of the equilibrium pressure. This research provides insights into the properties of long-chain compounds and their applications in various fields.
